intro: Metaplexis rostellata, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and flowering plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing along rocky soils and in desert scrub habitats. Metaplexis rostellata is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
